image.altText: Dead pink fish floating in an open ocean fish pen.

props.synopsis: The EPA report says samples of wild fish — all blue mackerel — taken near Huon fish pens tested above the reporting threshold, with one sample site showing a result 12 times higher than the maximum antibiotic threshold for commercially sold salmon.

title.children: Salmon company Huon used more than tonne of antibiotics in a fortnight, report finds

image.altText: A subdivision under construction in southern Tasmania

props.synopsis: Developers in Tasmania can apply for a rebate to offset some of the costs associated with subdivisions. It's part of a program aimed at fast-tracking lots for "affordable" sales but, after 10 months not one affordable lot has been sold.

title.children: Incentive for Tasmanian developers to sell land at 'affordable' prices so far fails to deliver

image.altText: A police officer opens a wire gate, behind which a police vehicle is parked. Two other police vehicles are also visible

props.synopsis: A man's body has been found in an "industrial-type bin" at the rear of a business on Hobart's eastern shore, with the garbage collector telling police he initially thought he'd discovered a "mannequin".

title.children: Garbage collector finds man's body in industrial bin

image.altText: Jacquie Lambie speaks to media.

props.synopsis: In her first interview since the election, Jacqui Lambie has told of her flagging health, her surprise at Labor's electoral turnaround, and her determination to keep Tasmanian issues on the national stage.

title.children: Lambie's surprise at Labor's campaign turnaround

image.altText: A man in a black shirt holding a live abalone.

props.synopsis: Chinese-farmed abalone is flooding the Chinese market, and it is bad news for the Tasmanian industry as its premium product gets crowded out of a lucrative market.

title.children: Tasmanian abalone farms close as pressure from Chinese market bucks profits

image.altText: Blue algae glow on the coastline

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian scientist says multiple marine events in her state suggests the environment is under stress, and there's a critical need to reduce pollution to alleviate some pressure.

title.children: Why south-east Tassie has suffered a succession of major marine events

image.altText: The rear of an ambulance driving down a wet road at dusk. The headlights of other cars can be seen shining.

props.synopsis: Distraught families say the New South Wales public mental health system abandoned their loved ones when they needed care the most — and doctors warn the crisis is only getting worse.

title.children: 'Days later she was dead': The families devastated by a collapsing mental health system

image.altText: A plate of food being passed to someone in a restaurant.

props.synopsis: Hannah takes a walk with a palawa bush food educator to learn about delicious native ingredients and the importance of preserving a connection to land and culture.

title.children: At piyura kitina/Risdon Cove traditional foods connect cultures

image.altText: an aboriginal man wearing a hoodie and bowler hat in a park

props.synopsis: Former Alice Springs Coles worker Gene Hill says it was clear an Aboriginal man who died in police custody at the supermarket last week had a disability and needed extra support.

title.children: Coles staffer says man who died in custody clearly had 'special needs'

image.altText: People cross at an intersection in Brisbane CBD in June 2018.

props.synopsis: Millions await minimum wage decision, which could impact consumer spending and interest rates. Follow live.

title.children: Millions await minimum wage decision, with impact on consumer spending and interest rates

image.altText: A logo says 'ASIC'.

props.synopsis: ASIC is suing insurance comparison provider Choosi for allegedly accepting $61 million in commissions to solely advertise services from one insurance company, Hannover.

title.children: ASIC accuses comparison site of promoting single insurer

image.altText: A woman having a cosmetic injectible in her lip.

props.synopsis: The Australian health practitioner regulator introduces sweeping new guidelines for dentists and nurses performing non-surgical cosmetic injectable procedures, in a bid to better protect consumers.

title.children: 'Crystal clear' new rules for nurses, dentists performing cosmetic injectables

image.altText: John Lennon and Yoko Ono sit near a piano and guitar in an interior space with visible window frames

props.synopsis: One To One: John & Yoko takes us inside the lives of the famous couple as they agitate for revolution in their new home city of New York.

title.children: New doco lets us eavesdrop on John and Yoko's conversations in the 70s

image.altText: GettyImages-2217425200

props.synopsis: Max Verstappen stops short of apologising for an incident involving George Russell at the Barcelona Grand Prix.

title.children: 'Emotions can run high': Verstappen addresses Russell incident

image.altText: GettyImages-2218226315

props.synopsis: Australia's Daria Kasatkina bows out of the French Open but pays tribute to her new Aussie fans.

title.children: 'Something new to me': Kasatkina praises Aussie fans after French Open exit

image.altText: A man with greying hair and a large bandage over his right ear emotionless in a police mugshot

props.synopsis: FBI documents allege Mohamed Sabry Soliman used a makeshift flamethrower and threw Molotov cocktails at a pro-Israel group in an attack he says he planned for more than a year.

title.children: Colorado terror attack suspect charged with hate crime

image.altText: A white headstone on a concreted grave glints in the afternoon sun.

props.synopsis: More than a century after his real name was written out of history, a chance encounter and a lucky find at a rubbish tip restore a soldier's true identity and return him to his family.

title.children: WWII soldier buried with wrong name for 80 years identified by pure luck

image.altText: A group of men and women in conversation as they descend a flight of stairs

props.synopsis: Delegations from the warring nations meet for peace talks in Istanbul, agreeing to exchange more prisoners of war but failing to reach a ceasefire deal.

title.children: Russia and Ukraine agree to prisoner swap but not ceasefire

image.altText: HESTA logo on a wall

props.synopsis: Australia's superannuation pool is worth nearly $4.2 trillion — the funds are undoubtedly extremely adept at taking members' money. But when it comes helping members to access it, they are falling short.

title.children: Is it acceptable to be locked out of your super fund for seven weeks?

image.altText: Cloud plumes coming from a volcano.

props.synopsis: Mount Etna, an active volcano on the east coast of Sicily, erupted on Monday, sending tourists on the mountain running for safety.

title.children: Mount Etna suddenly erupts, sending tourists fleeing for safety

image.altText: Emily Chamberlain

props.synopsis: A new initiative from a Queensland hospital hopes to bring an end to weight discrimination in maternity care.

title.children: Pregnant women left 'crying and exhausted' after questions over weight

image.altText: Joanna Pascua

props.synopsis: Joanna Pascua wins the right to Australian workplace protections despite living almost 6,000 kilometres away. Lawyers say she paved the way for legal claims, including class actions, against employers by "exploited" offshore workers.

title.children: Filipino woman changes the game for Australia's 'exploited' offshore workers

image.altText: A photo taken within a tunnel looking out into the light.

props.synopsis: A WA mayor says a new iron ore mine could impact his community's groundwater and wipe out a tourist attraction.

title.children: New WA mine prompts fears for historic rock tunnel

image.altText: A man poses smiling next to some mangoes on a tree.

props.synopsis: Neighbours describe a man who was critically injured when he was hit by an e-scooter, allegedly being ridden by a woman under the influence of alcohol in Perth, as a "kind and gentle" soul.

title.children: Man out for dinner in city when he was critically hurt in e-scooter crash

image.altText: Woman sitting by window and looking out. Rear view of woman drinking coffee, taking a break.

props.synopsis: Women are at risk of developing an eating disorder during perimenopause but there is a lack of research, education and support.

title.children: The rise of disordered eating among midlife women

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt is photographed outdoors with soft sunlight and greenery in the background.

props.synopsis: SA fashion entrepreneur Carol Foord turned to alternative treatments before her death. A year on her family is still seeking answers about how her final hours played out.

title.children: An Adelaide fashion icon died after using magic mushrooms. Her family wants answers

image.altText: A young woman and a little girl standing under a tree

props.synopsis: The family of Chantelle McDougall and her daughter Leela appeals for information as they continue to live with the "emotional roller-coaster" of their 2007 disappearance.

title.children: Baffling mystery of cult leader and family who vanished 18 years ago

image.altText: Children stand behind a sign that reads "Stop war".

props.synopsis: After Israel resumed its bombardment of Gaza, Palestinians took to the streets to protest against Hamas – and some are willing to keep speaking out even if it means violent reprisals.

title.children: Executions and reprisals: Hamas taking action as protests occur in Gaza

image.altText: Close up of a phone with SpaceX connectivity

props.synopsis: An Australia-first service using satellites to deliver text messages anywhere in the country promises to provide service to those living in mobile black spots.

title.children: Direct-to-satellite text messaging service gets first Australian users

image.altText: a man in a black puffer jacket stands among knee-high desiccated crops

props.synopsis: With this year's winter grain crop planted, ABARES estimates drought and dry conditions in SA, Victoria and NSW will see lower harvest totals this summer.

title.children: Drought delivers 8 per cent cut to grain production estimates

image.altText: Indigenous woman standing at fence

props.synopsis: When Kelly Anderson suddenly lost her daughter, she became depressed and rapidly gained weight. A community exercise program helped turn her life around.

title.children: The diabetes program lifting people out a 'really dark place'

image.altText: a chemist testing a drug sample

props.synopsis: Documents show the evaluation, which was due to be handed to the state government late last week, cost taxpayers $453,286.

title.children: Taxpayer-funded review of drug testing in Queensland may not be released

image.altText: A teenage nfl flag player holds a ball in one hand pointing it at the camera on a sports field on the Sunshine Coast

props.synopsis: A non-contact version of American football, flag football, is rapidly growing in popularity worldwide, according to officials, and the sport is investing heavily in Australia ahead of the next two Olympiads.

title.children: American giant's quest to become a top-three Australian sport

image.altText: Beef being cooked on a flaming grill.

props.synopsis: One of the biggest holidays on the Islamic calendar is happening on Friday. Here's how it's different to a feasting day with a similar name structure.

title.children: Eid al-Adha falls on a Friday this year. It could mean a lot of barbecues on the weekend
